title: Micron, Nike, BlackBerry, Braze: What to Watch in the Stock Market Today; Micron Technology beat analyst forecasts in quarterly results; BlackBerry earnings are due after the close
text:
* Nvidia rose 1.8%. The chip designer has lost 15% this month through Monday after its effort to buy Arm Holdings faced a setback in the U.S. Even after that drop, the stock was up more than a third for the final quarter of 2021.

* Semiconductor company Advanced Micro Devices also gained, adding 1.6%. Microchip Technology gained 2%.

* Nike rose 7.4% after a mixed set of results. Revenue of $11.4 billion in the quarter ended Nov. 30 was up 1% from the same period last year. Growth was stunted by a slowdown in production and transportation of its goods around the world.

* General Mills fell 4.4% after the food company reported second-quarter profit that fell short of expectations

* Software company Braze added 12% after it reported that its revenue rose 63% on the year in the third quarter. Braze listed on the Nasdaq Stock Market last month.

* Shares of Society Pass rose 5.1% after more than tripling Monday. The company, which went public in November, was added to the Russell 2000 index.

* Carnival rose 5% in another choppy session for the cruise stock, a bellwether for investor sentiment regarding the Omicron variant of coronavirus.

* BlackBerry will deliver its earnings report after the close.

Chart of the Day

* Say this much for Oracle: When they get a line of credit, they waste no time in using it, writes Dan Gallagher for Heard on the Street.

Write to Joe Wallace at joe.wallace@wsj.com

Micron, Nike, BlackBerry, Braze: What to Watch in the Stock Market Today
